info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 02 at 10:28PM CDT until June 02 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM CDT FOR KINNEY...NORTHERN MAVERICK...WESTERN UVALDE...NORTHWESTERN ZAVALA...SOUTHEASTERN EDWARDS AND SOUTHWESTERN REAL COUNTIES... At 1027 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Camp Wood to near Cline to near Spofford to 20 miles west of Quemado, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public reported large hail near Bracketville at 1020 PM. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Brackettville, Spofford, Quemado, Camp Wood, Laguna, Blewett, Paloma, Barksdale, Darling, Montell, Dabney, Cline, Anacacho, Reagan Wells, Radar Base, Alamo Village, Normandy, Laughlin AFB Aux Field, Turkey Mountain and Fort Clark Springs. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central Texas. These storms are producing destructive winds and large damaging hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Austin San Antonio.
